t: Why*pn do the nations rage, And*ld the people plot a vain thing?
The*ld kings of the earth set themselves, And*ld the rulers take counsel together, Against*ld the Lord*s and against His Anointed, saying,*i
“Let*ld us break Their bonds in pieces And*ld cast away Their cords from us.”
He*ln who sits in the heavens shall laugh; The*ld Lord shall hold them in derision.
Then*ld He shall speak to them in His wrath, And*ld distress them in His deep displeasure:
“Yet*ld I have set My King On*ld My holy hill of Zion.”
“I*ln will declare the decree: The*ld Lord*s has said to Me, ‘You*ld are*i My Son, Today*ld I have begotten You.
Ask*ld of Me, and I will give You*i The*ld nations for*i Your inheritance, And*ld the ends of the earth for*i Your possession.
You*ld shall break them with a rod of iron; You*ld shall dash them to pieces like a potter’s vessel.’”
Now*ln therefore, be wise, O kings; Be*ld instructed, you judges of the earth.
Serve*ld the Lord*s with fear, And*ld rejoice with trembling.
Kiss*ld the Son, lest He be angry, And*ld you perish in*i the way, When*ld His wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed*ld are*i all those who put their trust in Him.
